intro: Cyanotis rupicola, commonly known as the rock cycad, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asparagaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in countries like Thailand and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, blue-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in collections of rare and unusual flora.
